dmca.title: FW: Re: DMCA Copyright Notice [ThePlanetAbuse-C3561519A]
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA"), as it does not
identify (a) the copyrighted work claimed to have been infringed and (b)
the material that is claimed to be infringing, and information
reasonably sufficient to permit the The Planet to locate the said
material. 

 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.


> -----Original Message-----
> From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
> Sent: Tuesday, March 20, 2007 11:01 AM
> To: Copyright
> Subject: RE: Re: DMCA Copyright Notice [ThePlanetAbuse-C3561519A]
> 
> This message was received concerns a matter from a source deemed
> important enough for auto-forwarding. It is being forwarded to you for
> review and applicable action.
> 
> Abuse Department
> The Planet
> 
> 
> =====================
> Original Message
> =====================
> X-MailFrom: margaret_langston@timeinc.com
> X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net

> This is a multi-part message in MIME format.

> ------_=_NextPart_001_01C76B32.C842933A
> Content-Type: text/plain;
>         charset="us-ascii"
> Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
> 
> Dear ISP:
> 
> I am an attorney for Time Inc., the corporate publisher of People
> Magazine.  This will put you on notice that Time Inc. has concluded an
> agreement with a photo agency for exclusive rights to publish
> photographs of Angelina Jolie and Pax Thien Jolie, the child she is in
> the process of adopting, in People Magazine and on People.com.  These
> are the only photographs of Pax Thien Jolie now in existence.
> 
> In the past you have hosted websites which posted photographs which
have
> been licensed exclusively to Time Inc. for publication in People
> Magazine and on People.com, in violation of Time Inc.'s exclusive
> rights.
> 
> This letter is an official notification under the provisions of
Section
> 512(c) of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act that the posting of any
> photographs of Angelina Jolie and/or any other members of her family
or
> Brad Pitt with Pax Thien Jolie, would infringe Time Inc.'s rights in
> North America, Australia and New Zealand.  Be advised that by law, as
a
> service provider, you must "expeditiously remove or disable access to"
> the infringing photograph upon receiving notice. Noncompliance may
> result in a loss of the possibility of immunity under the DMCA.
> 
> I have a good faith belief that use of the material in the manner set
> forth herein would not be authorized by Time Inc., its licensing
> representatives, or the law.  The information provided herein is
> accurate to the best of my knowledge.  I hereby swear under penalty of
> perjury that I am authorized to act on behalf of Time Inc. for matters
> pertaining to notification of infringement, and bringing actions for
> infringement, of its exclusive rights in its copyrighted material.
> 
> Very truly yours,
> 
> =20
> 
> Nicholas J. Jollymore
> 
> Deputy General Counsel
> 
> Time Inc.
> 
> nicholas_jollymore@timeinc.com
> <mailto:nicholas_jollymore@timeinc.com>=20
> 
> =20
>
